laboratory_examinations.findings: Heterozygous missense mutations in two genes (PROKR2 c.253C.T; p.R85C and WDR11 c.1306A.G; p.I436V).
Low serum cortisol levels of approximately 1 to 2 mg/dL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hydrocortisone replacement was begun at 6 weeks of life.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Very low random growth hormone level of 0.93 ng/mL, low insulin-like growth factor-1 level of 27 ng/mL, low insulin-like growth factor-binding protein 3 level of 0.6 mg/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Height was below the first percentile at age 2 years; improved after starting recombinant human growth hormone therapy, increasing to the 38th percentile after approximately 15 months.
